Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2018 I was involved in a scam.My XXXX account had wrong billing information so I called XXXX to resolve the issue. The lines were disconnected and i received a call back from an individual falsely identifying themselves as employees of XXXX. The individual then informed that my XXXX account was being hacked. He told me I needed to buy XXXX cards to contact the servers to fix the situation. After I got them, he told me that I was being hacked by XXXX servers and I needed to purchase " XXXX XXXX '' cards. I purchased some and they were telling me that some of the cards were working and others were not and that i needed to purchase more to have my phone unhacked. They were telling me that i was going to get a full refund because it was a problem that happy because of XXXX and XXXX. It really got out of hand and I didn't realize it could be a scam till one of the banks told me that these has been happening recently. I had no idea. These individuals were using tech jargon and giving ID numbers and phone numbers, I honestly should have known and I used poor judgment in this matter. A police report was filled.

Furthermore, during the course of the investigation, they will send out generic requests for more information without identifying the dispute or charge they are requesting more information on. Consumer complaint narrative:
Experian and XXXX Credit Reporting Agencies are allowing two debt collectors to publish information on my credit report in violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practice Act. According to that " Act '' debt collectors are required to contact me first regarding a debt and allow me 30 days to submit a written request for validation of the debt. Both Experian and XXXX are publishing information on my credit report regarding a collection account owed to XXXX XXXX # XXXX in the amount of {$3100.00} ; however, I am not familiar with XXXX XXXX and I never received any notice of debt from the company before it was published on my credit report. I was denied my important rights under Federal and State law. I contacted both agencies to let them know that XXXX XXXX violated the law and denied me my rights under federal law but no action was taken. 

Experian and XXXX further violated my rights by placing a second collection account on my report that was placed by XXXX XXXX XXXX. This company did send me a notice of debt about 6 months ago and within 30 days I submitted a request for validation of debt, in which I informed the agency that I have never enjoyed a XXXX account. XXXX did not contact me further, but recently in violation of Federal Law, XXXX placed a collection action on my account causing my credit score to drop.

Consumer complaint narrative: I AM A VICTIM OF IDENTITY THEFT. There were accounts open in my name. I notified the company in writing by sending them notarized identity theft forms and statements, and a multitude of correspondence, yet the fraudulent accounts still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. They stated in both the first investigation as well as the re-investigation that they verified that those accounts and that they were being reported correctly, which was COMPLETELY UNTRUE!! I then, demanded that this company not only tell me who verified these accounts as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), I demanded to know the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). I also requested that this company send me a copy of the original creditors documentation, or ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as they are required under FCRA to keep a copy in their files to verify that this information is mine and correct. THEY DID NOT DO ANY OF THE ABOVE. Under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA they are required to promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. Pursuant to section 605B they are required to BLOCK the fraudulent information on my credit report resulting from identity theft within 4 business days and notify the furnisher of that information, in which they HAVE NOT DONE! THE LAW IS VERY CLEAR AND THEY FAIL TO COMPLY WITH FEDERAL LAW. I have made MULTIPLE attempts to have them delete these fraudulent accounts that were the result of identity theft, off of my credit report, yet the accounts still remain, and this company continues to violate my rights under FCRA.

Thanks, XXXX XXXX

Product: Checking or savings account
Mortgage
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
SPS 2nd : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Before we begin it is important to note that SPS services both the 1st and 2nd loans on this property, and that they belong to different investors, with differing guidelines, that are in conflict with one another. This creates many problems when it comes to short sales, or any other type of negotiation, as they can not best protect either investor in a situation where the demands from each investor require the other to lower their net proceeds. SPS does not allow a prospective buyer to bring in additional monies to satisfy a demand from a junior lien holder, and in the State of California, a seller is never allowed to contribute any monies to satisfy demands. So that means the offer on the table is the only amount of money we have to work with to satisfy all liens on a property. 

The time line below shows the level of gross incompetence and possible purposeful negligence of the underwriting department in the review for loss mitigation on BOTH loans for this property. I have highlighted with *** the particularly problematic issues and communications. They have 2 sets of rules that are in direct conflict with one another. They should have known that there was no way for them to work out this loss mitigation file. 

XX/XX/XXXX Submitted to SPS offer was {$430000.00} XX/XX/XXXX Got value back of XXXX. We were asked to increase the net but not told what they required. 

XX/XX/XXXX Called the SPS Ombudsman to see if they could find out what the minimum required net is, and they were unable to tell me. 

XX/XX/XXXX - We sent market comps and an inspection report to support our offer of XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX Rep at ombudsmans office said we were about 6k off minimum net required. We revised the HUD to reflect an increase to the net proceeds to the 1st trust deed by XXXX and sent that back to SPS XX/XX/XXXX Per Ombudsman, no response to our higher net. 

XX/XX/XXXX Called ombudsman, no response. Ombudsman sent message to underwriting to please get response XXXX Per the Ombudsman, underwriting somehow managed to close the review on XXXX yet the ombudsman never got notice of that, and wasn't apparent in the database. Instead, underwriting approved the XXXX 's for a repayment plan. The ombudsman can do NOTHING until one of the XXXX 's call in to decline that repayment on a recorded line. they can call the ombudsman to do so, to make sure it gets done right. we need to send all short and offer docs again to both XXXX and XXXX along with a letter requesting rush review due to us thinking we were in review for an entire month and no one ever told us we weren't. 

XX/XX/XXXX Resubmitted entire file and the homeowner called the ombudsman to decline payment plan that was never requested. 

XX/XX/XXXX Per XXXX in the Ombudsman department, the underwriter on the 1st denied the offer again wanting a further increased net. Yet again, they refused to provide us what net they wanted, making this a very frustrating guessing game for the buyers and the sellers. 

XX/XX/XXXX We increased the net again, and resubmitted the new offer. 

XX/XX/XXXX Underwriting for the 2nd demanded a corrected RMA and we sent that back on the same day XX/XX/XXXX Ombudsman told us that both loans were active in short sale review. 

XX/XX/XXXX We were told it looked like the 1st and 2nd were negotiating between each other and to expect decision by XX/XX/XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX Finally got word that the investor for the 1st Trust Deed approved the short sale and that now the file can go to the investor to the 2nd for approval. As is normal for ALL short sales we do with SPS, the net to the 2nd was {$8500.00}. It is important to note here, that SPS never allows more than XXXX to go to a junior lien on any short sale, except in some GSE situations where the guidelines state the maximum is XXXX. We were told by SPS that they had internally approved the 2nd and just needed investor signoff. 
XXXX We were now told that the 2nd is requiring no less than 25,000 to approve the short sale, on a loan of XXXX. This is where the conflict of interest comes into play when the same company is servicing the 1st and 2nd for different investors. In NO short sale would SPS ever allow 30 % of the UPB to go to a 2nd when the 1st is still short. We were asked to revise the HUD showing XXXX to the 2nd. At that point I informed the Ombudsman that I believe we would then have a problem with the 1st, as we had already been fighting over meeting their net proceeds and per their investors policy of not allowing any 3rd party including the buyer or agents to contribute to satisfy junior liens, and the State of Californias law that sellers may not contribute in a short sale, this would then result in a substantial decrease to the net on the 1st. Ombudsman still asked us to send the HUD showing increased net to the 2nd, and decreased net to the 1st. We sent it same day. 

XXXX Ombudsman confirmed receipt of new HUD and attached it to both accounts. 

XXXX Ombudsman escalated issue again for resolution on the issues with both the 1st and 2nd nets. 
**** At this point I started calling twice a day for updates**** XX/XX/XXXX Still nothing back explained to ombudsman that based on the 1st TD approval letter and the verbal that the 2nd had been internally approved, that the buyer started working on their loan. Now their rate lock is expiring and asked them to please escalate again. Was told that they would attempt to escalate this to the highest level of management to get it going. Was also reassured that the issues for the 1st and the 2nd were escalated and tied together. 

XXXX Was told investor for 2nd has approved the file, but it needed to go through QC and there was nothing they could do regarding the net issues for the 1st until the letter for the 2nd had been issued even though we had been told repeatedly that they were escalated TOGETHER. 

XX/XX/XXXX Was told that the ombudsman had this escalated to the highest level and they send a message to find out what was taking so long. 

XX/XX/XXXX. Was told by ombudsman department that it had notes in the system for the 2nd from the 8th that it was being worked on by XXXX. 

XXXX Was told by ombudsman that this had only been sent to QC on the XXXX. We asked how that could possibly be the case and referenced our previous notes, we were then told it had failed QC on the XXXX but there were no notes as to why and that it was sent back to QC on the XXXX and escalated again. 

XXXX. Was told that the 2nd TD NEVER SENT THE FILE TO THE INVESTOR. They had NO EXPLANATION about all the times I was told it was approved and the approval letter was in the QC department. At this point it is obvious that we have been lied to throughout the entire process with SPSs 2nd TD department. ************Keep in mind we started this short sale with SPS on XX/XX/XXXX, so we have been LIED TO FOR OVER FOUR MONTHS. They have harmed not only their own investor ( s ) and their borrower, but also the buyer as they are preventing them from finding another property in this difficult market. 

I want SPS fined to the maximum amount allowed by law, I want the conflict of interest investigated and I want the short sale approved AS IT STANDS for both the 1st and the 2nd liens and I want SPS to be required to make up the difference for their investors.

**See attached 1st TD Approval Letter.

CC : US Ho
use Committee on Financial Services Chairwoman XXXX XXXX.

Attorney General XXXX XXXX

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
A recent inquiry into my credit report with all 3 bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX  and XXXX ) made me aware of 2 accounts that report negatively on my credit bureau files. Research revealed that these 2 entities are owned by the parent company known as XXXX XXXX , XXXX . These 2 entities are XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX  XXXX. These debts are not mine, yet they appear on my credit bureau file ( s ) as charged off debts. 

The XXXX XXXX account appears with a balance due of {$150.00}. I have never had an account with this organization. The XXXX XXXX XXXX account appears on my credit bureau file ( s ) as an Unsecured loan account with a charged off balance of {$410.00}. I have never obtained a loan from this organization and based on the corporate description, was unaware that they offered such services. 

In correspondence dated XX/XX/XXXX ; I requested proof of my obligation to pay from both of these organizations. They responded with a letter requesting that I send them a police report for identity theft. I responded with a second letter dated XX/XX/XXXX again requesting validation in the form of ANY application for an account for credit or a contract bearing my signature. They both responded on XX/XX/XXXX with a print out of a bill ; which according to an FTC opinion letter is NOT sufficient proof that a debt belongs to a particular individual. 

According to the FCRA these debts have not been proven to belong to me and should therefore be removed from all 3 credit reporting agencies files. Subsequent requests for the same have not been honored by the credit bureas or by either of these organizations. The credit bureaus continue to report these debts as mine and I have also requested thier Method of Verification for these debts which they have yet to provide. A subsequent complaint regarding the actions or inaction of the 3 major credit bureaus is forthcoming. Additionally, I have a filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau ( BBB ) in Wisconsin and am planning to file a complaint with the Texas Attorney General 's Office.

Dear CFPB Office of the Ombudsman : My student loan servicer NELNET who services federal student loans to the credit agencies XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX may have violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act and other credit reporting laws. 

There is reason to believe that the loans serviced by Nelnet where not properly serviced or reported based on the following occurrences. 

Reported Timeline ( historical ) data removed No data credit reporting Reported balances after consolidation XX/XX/XXXX Incorrect address reported ( XX/XX/XXXX ) I understand that any inaccuracy including material inaccuracies may be grounds for injury-in-fact and other harm. The data furnisher NELNET and the credit bureaus XXXX, XXXX XXXX and XXXX  blame the data furnisher for the reporting inaccuracies and or credit redactions. 

I am requesting an audit of the reporting history of fifteen federal student loan accounts held by Nelnet, and the three credit bureaus update their records according to the complete account history ; ( XXXX ), that includes all historical data, date opened, and historical timeline, and the loans are paid and consolidated. 

The loans have been consolidated XX/XX/XXXX to a different servicer. 

Customer service representatives at Nelnet said to me that disputing information to the credit bureau will cause credit score decreases because they will respond that the information was frivolous and accurate. This also indicated to me problems with the servicers dispute and resolution process and what procedures they use in cases of disputed accuracy and my rights under Federal law including the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

I am asking the Ombudsman to investigate credit reporting activities by the servicer NELNET and audit of the credit reporting history from Nelnet. I have scanned copies of the credit report from XXXX to show the reported timeline. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: After separation from my ex-husband, and subsequent divorce, I came to find out that I was still listed on our joint bank account and the balance had fallen into the negative. The negative balance associated with this account was well over {$1000.00}. I was fully unaware of the negative status of this account, and certainly had no idea that it had been charged off. I am still unsure of how it is legal for a bank to allow such an excessive charge to pass through, when there is no money in said account. In the terms of our divorce decree, it is stipulated that any and all debts incurred during the time of our legal separation are the financial responsibility of the party who acquired them. These charges were incurred solely by my ex-husband, and the bank associate even confirmed that it was clear to her, that the only debit card in use was his own personal card. Mine was entirely inactive. Even after calling in and pleading my case with the bank and offering to provide proof in the form of divorce documents, there was no consideration made to removing me from the liability of this debt. This debt affects me in two critical ways : I am unable to obtain any new bank accounts in the future until this debt is fully paid, and secondly, it is strongly impacting my credit score in a negative way. As a now single mother, I simply can not afford to pay for the gross financial irresponsibility of my ex-husband. That being the case, I feel XXXX should reconsider my request to remove my financial liability from this account, and the continuing mark on my credit, and be satisfied in pursuing XXXX XXXX for his debt.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX I purchased a condo and the original creditor was XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I took out two mortgages for the condo at 80 % on first and 20 % on second. XXXX XXXX was an operating sub of XXXX and both were taken over by Bank of America in XXXX. 

In XXXX I was contacted by Bank of America via mail that I was eligible for loan modifications under the HAMP program. I contacted the using the number on the letter. The agent that I spoke to informed me that I would be eligible but first I needed to quit paying my mortgages. She stated that I needed to contact her in 3 months after non-payment. 

In three months the agent informed me that she would be sending out a modification package in the mail. Upon receiving it I filled it out and she informed me to continue to not pay my mortgages. Several months later in XXXX I received my modification package. The principal on the mortgage was {$110000.00} which was XXXX higher than the original 1st. I asked the agent about the 2nd mortgage and if I would be getting another bill. She replied that as far as she was concerned the 2nd was finished and that I was to ignore any and all bills for the property except the one sent by bank of america. She additionally stated that I would be receiving information in the future settling the 2nd mortgage and that it was going to be extinguished and discharged. She stated that I would be receiving a XXXX for the difference if there was one. 

During the modification process all financial adjustments and payments were reported on bills that were consistent with the XXXX XXXX XXXX statements. Upon completion of the trial period and upon transferring over to bank of america bills for the mortgage I received a statement from XXXX XXXX with regards to the 2nd mortgage that showed that the balance was adjusted to XXXX. It was dated in conjunction to the billing reflected on the first mortgage and the bank of america modification. 

I never received any bill with regard to the 2nd mortgage after the modification was completed. 3-4 years later I received a bill in the mail from a third party company that has been trying to collect. I emphatically deny the legitimacy of this debt. 

At the recorder of deeds it shows that the deed of trust assignment for the first mortgage was transferred to bank of america in XXXX of XXXX yet the 2nd mortgage has remained unchanged since XXXX. 

Upon conducting a title search it is clear that bank of america owns the 2nd mortgage still. I have tried to reach out via phone and email to bank of america only to get canned responses. 

I understand that in the early days of HAMP bank of america was contracting with third party companies to administrate the modifications. I also understand that these companies had poorly trained staff. I speculate that it is quit possible that while the third party organized the information and handed it back to bank of america that it is likely that the documentation was lost or incorrectly filed and that the 2nd mortgage was sold as an unsecured debt to a third party. 

I understand that in XXXX there was a settlement with the department of justice in which bank of america had to correct and amend several decisions that it had made as its practices were in violation of the HAMP program. I would greatly appreciate if Bank of America would take the necessary steps to reply to these issues responsibly so that this can come to a close. 

I have attached all documentation that is in my possession to support my claims.

Consumer complaint narrative:
During the period of XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX, my checking/saving/select credit Accounts in HSBC were used for the following unauthorized transactions : {$4900.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX - wire transfer from checking ) {$4000.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX - wire transfer from checking, already credited back on XXXX ) {$5000.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX - wire transfer from saving ) {$8600.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX - wire transfer from saving, already credited back on XXXX ) {$2400.00} ( XXXX - electronic transfer from checking ) {$2400.00} ( XXXX - electronic transfer from checking ) The hacker also transferred {$4500.00} from the select credit account to my checking on XX/XX/XXXX in order to facilitate some of these unauthorized transactions. 

Origin : The E-fraud prevention team from HSBC bank called me on XX/XX/XXXX and wanted me to confirm some recent online activities on my accounts. I missed their phone call initially so I tried to call back that afternoon but the wait time is too long. I finally managed to call them back next morning on XXXX. The representative informed me my accounts was compromised. He went through the unauthorized transactions with me and said only the transaction of {$4000.00} can be recalled immediately and for the rest they will investigate and get back to me in a few days. 

Couple days later I am able to see one transaction ( {$8600.00} ) credited back to my account. I called them for a status on the remaining transactions and they are still working on that. That representative said it would take a maximum of 10 days to get me a final response otherwise will credit full amount back to my accounts. 

On XXXX, I sent a formal letter to HSBC headquarter in XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX to notify them that I am a victim of identity theft and never authorize anyone else to use my accounts in any way. This is to protect me in case the bank said I never contact them in written statement about the matter. 

Afterward I called them a couple of times on XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX to get a status for the remaining transactions, and every time I was told I need to wait few more days to finish their investigation. The last time we spoke on XX/XX/XXXX, they said they need 8-10 more business days to investigate!

Note : Attached is the formal letter I sent to HSBC headquarter using certified mail. The reference number of the case they opened for investigation is : XXXX - XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
For some reason Barclays Bank Delaware has not sent me proof of my obligation of this alleged debt as requested and continues to report this trade-line to the major credit bureaus. This is creating issues for me such as higher interest rates, lower credit scores, job declines, and application rejects for outstanding balances owed. 

I disputed this account XX/XX/2019 on my XXXX  and XXXX  credit reports to no avail. To date, Barclays Bank Delaware continues to ignore my requests and they continue to ignore my consumer rights. 

I believe this account does not belong to me. I requested the documents from their files used to verify this account. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to demand they disclose all of the documents they have recorded and retained in their files at the time of the request concerning the accounts that are reporting in my credit report. All unverified accounts must be deleted. 

Who verified this account? What documents did they use to verify? Where are the documents used to verify? 

The only correspondence that I received was a letter informing me they received my dispute. This does not qualify as verification per FCRA. This company is in violation for continuing to verify the account with the credit bureaus without providing the evidence as requested. It is my contention that Barclays Bank Delaware knows they can not tie me to this alleged account, otherwise, they would have done so when I made my initial request. Barclays Bank Delaware is blatantly disregarding the law.

Say what? You don't want my money? Anyways, Greentree apparently changed the terms of the loan and now I have an escrow account. Two years later I realized it wasn't going away because I was paying homeowners insurance and property taxes twice which ripped me off for over {$6000.00} cuz I wasn't looking. This is when I heard of Greentree / XXXX XXXX Class Action Lawsuit and suddenly I'm back with Ditech ( but with altered terms- escrow ). For the last 3 years I have tried to get Ditech to remove the escrow requirements since they are not my primary mortgage lender. Ditech finally did after some " legal intervention '' but now charge me a {$6.00} monthly " servicing '' fee and every year they force place insurance policies on my account and the phone calls start all over again. Hello year # 4. A simple XXXX search revealed a lot I did not know regarding how XXXX  suddenly disappeared during the Class Action and is now Ditech. Thus why I join the ranks of the growing dis-contentment in a public forum. I just want my original terms which I have in writing from 2007 honored and stop all the shenanigans to score a few extra $ $ $ from people who thought they could trust a contract. -XXXX

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I had a credit card with Barclays. The dispute came from fees they assessed against my account. I always pay my bill in full, and they suddenly charged over {$50.00} in interest one month. I discovered later that they did this because they accidentally posted a payment on my account, and they charged me interest for three months from the time they posted the payment until they discovered the error. During these 3 months, I had been paying the full amount on my bill by the due date. 

When I discovered Barclays ' error, I made the payment in the amount that they had posted, but I contested the amount of interest because it was not my fault. I received 3 standard responses that " We are unable to complete your request. '' I stopped using my Barclays credit card, started making arrangements to get a new credit card, and I used {$75.00} in " rewards '' to reduce my balance. Then, I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX that stated that they had posted {$29.00} in " interest charge-purchases '' on my account on XX/XX/XXXX. The amount was the balance on my account, not the fees/interest that Barclays had charged on my account. Regardless, upon receiving that letter, I wrote a check in amount of {$29.00}, returned my credit card, and asked them to close my account, with the hope that I would no longer deal with Barclays. 

Since then, I have continued to received bills from Barclays. Apparently, they are charging a fee over {$20.00} per month on an account that has been closed and paid in full. In XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a letter to explain that they had not properly investigated my dispute, and that I should get a refund instead of bills. I received no response. Instead, I received a new statement in the amount of {$41.00}. 

I am writing to complain that Barclays ( 1 ) failed to investigate a dispute as required by the Truth in Lending Act, and ( 2 ) continued to charge fees on a closed account that has been paid in full. 

I am attaching my correspondence with Barclays regarding this matter. Thank you for any assistance you could provide.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX SSN : XXXX | DOB : XX/XX/XXXX Experian XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX I am outraged that your company continues to maintain a dismissed ( filed ) bankruptcy as confirmed on my credit report. This unconfirmed, unverified, and dismissed ( filed ) bankruptcy has stopped me from obtaining credit. I know for a fact your company receives information on bankruptcy from a third party system known as a XXXX XXXX. The XXXX XXXX is inaccurate and incomplete since the XXXX XXXX does not provide complete social security numbers as that would be against the Fair Credit Reporting Act and Privacy Laws. Furthermore, I have been in contact with the county courthouse and they also assured me they do not report full social security numbers to thirty parties or make social security numbers public record. Even though it is your company 's policy to keep reporting a bankruptcy that is filed, dismissed, or adjudicated for 10 years, the Fair Credit Reporting Act mentions nothing in Section 1681 ( c ) relating to bankruptcy about dismissals or filings. The law is very clear and states from the date of adjudication or date of order of relief. 

Any case, whether it be civil or otherwise, once dismissed it no longer exists in the eyes of the law. This case filed may never have actually been adjudicated. You have no right to maintain information which the government has deemed non-existent. It is only fair that in accordance with section 1618 ( a ) ( 5 ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act you delete this from my credit report and send me an updated copy.

Considering this does not require an investigation, I would appreciate an updated copy of my credit report showing no bankruptcy within two weeks from the date you receive this letter. 


Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
On or around XX/XX/XXXX a collections account appeared on my credit report. I did not know who this was r what it was for. The name listed was XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ) I looked them up and called them on the phone. They informed me that the Original Creditor was XXXX. They said that the bill was from XX/XX/2013 but could not tell me what the phone number was attached to the bill. I then explained to them that I have been a XXXX customer in good standing for over 15 years and that my monthly payments are automatically deducted from my bank account, and that this wasnt my bill. 

I questioned them as to how they could put this on my credit report without ever sending me a bill. They couldnt answer that question. The person I spoke said that they would send me out a form to dispute the bill. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter from XXXX with a form included to file a fraud complainant with XXXX. I had never once said that fraud had been committed. I then took this information and went to XXXX and had them look up the account in question. They informed me that there was no record of the account other than that it was turned over to XXXX. XXXX informed me that XXXX had all of the documentation associated with the account in question. 
When I spoke with a representative at XXXX they informed me that they had nothing either, just that they had bought the debt from somewhere. Since I got nowhere with XXXX or XXXX I filed a dispute through all three credit reporting agencies. They all came back that the account was valid. 

I have never received anything from this company ( XXXX  ) no bills no statements nothing. I am at a loss as to how a company can put something on your credit report without validating the debt, even when I spoke with them on the phone they had nothing to establish that the debt was mine. I had a credit score of over 750 before they added this account, by adding this they dropped my score by 85 points which was very damaging to my credit. I am not sure how they can do that. 

I am hoping that by reaching out for help I can get this taken care of.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
My husband and I were trying to refinance our home in XXXX, XXXX when we were made aware of an issue on our Equifax report. Our Equifax report listed two bankruptcies ; one in XXXX of XXXX filed with a local court, a true bankruptcy that we did indeed file, and another in XXXX with the same filing number, information, etc. but filed in a different court in a city we had never visited. We of course tried to contact Equifax regarding this information. They did update our credit report, but still listed both bankruptcies with the same filing information. The only thing they changed was the date. Both bankruptcies now have the same true date of filing, but show different counties. This of course has caused issues for us in terms of refinancing as it now looks like we have two bankruptcies on our history. I tried to contact the court at the number Equifax used to " verify '' the information. The number, XXXX-XXXX-XXXX, is not in service. I actually called this exact number a second time while on the phone with an Equifax representative trying to prove that there was no way they used that phone number to verify the incorrect information and was told " I should look for another number ''. I further asked how else they were able to contact to verify the information, and they only gave me a physical address. I asked them again how else they were able to verify the information, as I knew they did not personally visit the location, and I was told to look for another contact number. 

I did some research on the secondary filing location of XXXX County. This bankruptcy court has been closed since XXXX, a year before we actually even filed for bankruptcy ( XXXX ), and 3 years before Equifax accepted a new filing from that address ( XXXX ). Upon further investigation and reaching out to people to help, we have learned that this is a very common issue with Equifax. I have emails from a clerk of courts that state that numerous people have had the same issue with Equifax claiming this closed court as a viable entity and accepting bankruptcies from this court address. 

I have spent countless hours on the phone trying to get this fixed. It has been suggested by Equifax representatives and per their advertising while on hold, that we pay for a credit repair service to help us correct this issue. I even had an online message via XXXX messenger from XXXX XXXX stating that a senior representative would be contacting me. This message was sent on XX/XX/XXXX and I have yet to receive any additional contact. I do continue to receive emails that my claim has been looked at, but can no longer login to my Equifax account because my personal information, the same information I use to contact a representative live, does not match their records. I have, of course, called and the only resolution they have come to is that they verified the false bankruptcy court and changed the date of filing. 

I feel like this has been an ongoing issue for consumers like me. The fact that this bankruptcy court has been closed for 6 years and that Equifax is allowing " verified reports '' from it, is ridiculous. Additionally, the fact that they could not actually give me anyway in which they truly " verified '' the information, other than a disconnected phone number is VERY disturbing. Our credit is being held hostage and we have no way to negate what Equifax is reporting. Also, the fact that it was constantly suggested via their advertising and through their own agents that we should go through their " preferred partner '', XXXX, further incites me, as people should not have to pay to have fraudulent/unverifiable information removed from THEIR personal credit report.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
My Challenge in a nut shell is the servicing lenders sell the contract and dont apply the payments correctly. 

This is the third time this has happened in 2 years. I send the servicing folks emails and call and then get a reply they have 30 days to get back to me and dont. 

This started in XX/XX/XXXX when Selene finance took over my Mortgage payment. Selene Finance wrote I was behind 90 days and if I didnt pay they would foreclose on my home. 

However the previous lender received XXXX for property taxes, mortgage payments in XXXX. In the month of XX/XX/XXXX. Selene finance said I had to take it up with that company this is what I owed. So I did pay them all the payments. But because I had waited on trying to get the funds placed property I was assessed " property Assessment '' of XXXX to XXXX charges every week. 

After I paid the 90 days of payments and excessive fees I signed the mortgage contracts to have ACH withdrawal. However 2 days later I called and stopped the ACH withdrawal from XXXX and then I called and places stop payments for the ACH withdrawals. I was nervous the payments would not be placed correctly since I was over paying to go to interest. 

Unfortunately Selene finance Did not stop the ACH withdrawal so I did at my bank. This caused all the OD fees that were not OD fees but cancelled ACH pulls. Selene would auto pay my account it gets rejected as a stop payment and I get tagged XXXX they then would pull again the next day same thing XXXX in fees rejected. 

My Bill pay checks would put on the account with the extra funds to go to OD fees or property assessment fees. Instead of to interest. 

I would call, Selene customer Service phone person, would say resubmit I would, then I would get charges XXXX for each Bank charge from them saying NSF when it was not NSF but they sent back. I have times I called, who I spoke with including follow-up emails. After 6 months of this I finally was able to get a hold of a supervisor who went thru the account with me reversed the XXXX od fees places the extra payments correctly and revered the XXXX property assessment fees. 

All goes well until XXXX of XXXX when check was sent back, attached ... 

this was the same practice that caused all the excessive fees again. the supervisor placed the funds correctly. Selene finance kept charging me the XXXX until XXXX. With the customary letter of NSF/ ACH. This came back on XXXX. I resent the Check. Again 2 more XXXX fees for the XXXX stop payments from ACH withdrawal payments thats was cashed by Selene finance. My XXXX payment was cashed with no problem sent as bill pay. and still OD fees.XXXX I call in XXXX, to Selene finance when I receive the letter that my contracts were sold to XXXX XXXX. However XXXX XXXX  says I owe 90 days of payments XXXX XXXX and XXXX. 

I sent my XXXX payment it was sent back. on XX/XX/XXXX, I sent my XXXX payment and it was accepted by XXXX XXXX who know tell me I owe for 6 months of payments plus fees. If I do not pay they will foreclose on my home. 

I have sent to both parties emails showing the copies of the cashed checks to both parties. Yet Selene finance will not contact me. I have asked for mediation on the excess fees and accounting practices Nothing. 

I have all emails and correspondence I have sent to all parties. XXXX XXXX has not had me sign any paperwork for them yet. No mortgage paperwork. 

Please any help would be great. I am concerned they will foreclose on my home.. 

My phone number is XXXX. My email is XXXX. My work number is XXXX. I work for XXXX in XXXX XXXX.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
TAKE JUDICIAL NOTICE OF CASES : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX v EQUIFAX INFORMATION SERVICES LLC Equifax has continued to violate the law as there continues to show a Public Record that is not furnished or reported from a reliable source with 1st hand knowledge. 

Also anyone can produce a phone number to the court but WHO did you speak to at the court to verify the accuracy of this Public Record and furthermore the courts DO NOT SEND DATA TO YOUR FIRM!! 

XXXX  and XXXX  both have removed the public record ... .why are you still causing me harm and damage? 

The New Jersey class action claimed Equifax violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act by sending letters that falsely told consumers that it confirms the veracity of disputed public-record information by contacting the source a county court, in this instance directly. 
In reality, however, Equifax never directly contacts the public-information sources, and uses a third-party company to investigate the disputed information, the suit claimed. 
In response to a consumers dispute regarding the accuracy of a public record, it [ Equifax ] never contacts the original source of the information, but rather contacts the private independent company that it never discloses to the consumer, according to the suit. 
Under a settlement agreement given final approval by U.S. District Judge XXXX XXXX Wednesday, Equifax will not represent that the government and/or any court or courthouse is a furnisher of information in response to a consumers dispute ; will not represent that the government and/or any court or courthouse was contacted directly by Equifax in connection with any consumers dispute ; and will not represent that the government and/or any court or courthouse actually investigated a consumers dispute. 
Lead class counsel will receive over {$1.00} million, and the three class representatives will receive {$15000.00} apiece, according to the terms of the settlement.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Navient gave me wrong information regarding deferments. Navient told me I could not cancel my deferment and make payments. Navient, it seems, did not process my payments correctly. Navient did not refer me to XXXX when I requested to be in the 10 year loan forgiveness program. 

When I went back to school XX/XX/2016 at XXXX my loan automatically went into deferment. When I called Navient to say I still wanted to make payments toward my 120 qualifying payments for loan forgiveness, Navient told me that I if I made payments while I was in deferment the payments would not be counted towards the 120 payments. I said I did not want my loan in deferment. The Navient rep told me that while I was in school my loan would be in deferment and I did not have to make payments while it was in deferment. Again I said I don't want my loan in deferment. I asked how can this be resolved? The Navient rep had no answer for me. I called back again to talk with another rep who gave me the same story. I found out from another Navient rep a year later that what I was told was not true. I could have continued to make IBR payments, I needed to call another phone number to request a deferment cancellation and reapply for an IBR plan.

XXXX XXXX who now has my loan and has taken a year so far to process Navients payments. XXXX has said that they needed to carefully look at each one to make sure it was processed correctly and is a qualifying payment. There automated system only found 6 qualifying payments, there are 31 more payments that need to be looked at more closely by hand. These payments may or may not be qualifying.

Additionally, Navient told me that I didnt have to fill out any paperwork to apply for the loan forgiveness program. I asked several times in the 5 years. They said I just needed to make IBR payments for 10 years and my loan will be forgiven. I found out from a co-worker that I should have submitted an application for the student loan forgiveness. When I talked to Navient about this form they gave me the number for XXXX  and told me that XXXX handle the processing of this form. Navient rep also said that I didn't have to fill out this form but it was a good idea. They also made it seem like XXXX just processed these applications. I realize after filling out the online application and paperwork that my loan was being transferred from Navient to XXXX and that XXXX was another loan handler.

Problems I am having -- Problem 1 -- I missed a year of payments because Navient told me that I couldnt make IBR payments while I was in deferment and that I couldnt get out of deferment while I was in school. This was incorrect. I could have been one year closer to being finished with these loans. And if I get stuck with this loan because Navient didn't process my payments correctly I'm paying a years worth of interest on top of that. Problem 2 -- Navient should have sent me to XXXX XXXX from the beginning if they could not provide adequate services, paperwork and application for the 10 year loan forgiveness payment plan. Problem 3 -- XXXX says I only have 6 qualifying  payments from Navient so far, and Ive made over 5 YEARS worth of payments with Navient.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Over several years, Navient has used harassing tactics in attempt to collect a student loan debt. Last XX/XX/XXXX, they called several times before XXXX asking for a payment I had already submitted. 

I preemptively called and informed them that due to personal circumstances, I nor my guarantor was able to make XX/XX/XXXX 's payment by the due date ( XX/XX/XXXX ). I stated that I would be able to pay it by the first week of XX/XX/XXXX and the representative stated that there was nothing they could do. I asked that they at least notate the payment would be late and they refused. 


I received a call XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX requesting payment, during which I informed the representative that I would be remitting payment shortly. I completed the payment XX/XX/XXXX, receiving a confirmation number and seeing the deduction from my bank account. 

Today, XX/XX/XXXX I received 3 separate phone calls from the number XXXX. One at XXXX, one at XXXX, and one at XXXX. I answered the third to discover that it was a Navient representative calling to say they were trying to collect the XX/XX/XXXX payment - the one I had already submitted. I explained that to the representative, who used the computer system to verify it. She said she would make a note that the payment was there and to stop the calls. I asked her to please check for payments before calling - especially 3 times back to back. She became argumentative, stating there was nothing she could do about it and that I should just make my payments on time. I explained to her that this has happened even when I made my payments on time and she became more argumentative, talking over me, and unwilling to hear my position or take responsibility for repeatedly calling me under false pretences.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX ATTENTION DISPUTE DEPARTMENT TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXX JEFFERSON CAPITAL SYST XXXX Your company have violated FCRA 615 ( f ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681m ( f ) ) ( f ) Prohibition on sale or transfer of debt caused by identity theft You have not responded to my request to provide me with an investigation report.

I need this resolve, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence ( 1 ) In general No person ( company ) shall sell, transfer for consideration, or place for collection a debt that such person has been notified under section 1681c-2 of this title has resulted from identity theft.

( 2 ) Applicability The prohibitions of this subsection shall apply to all persons collecting a debt described in paragraph ( 1 ) after the date of a notification under paragraph ( 1 ).

( 3 ) Rule of construction Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prohibit -- ( A ) The repurchase of a debt in any case in which the assignee of the debt requires such repurchase because the debt has resulted from identity theft ; ( B ) the securitization of a debt or the pledging of a portfolio of debt as collateral in connection with a borrowing ; or ( C ) the transfer of debt as a result of a merger, acquisition, purchase and assumption transaction, or transfer of substantially all of the assets of an entity.

A person that furnishes information to any consumer reporting agency shall have in place reasonable procedures to respond to any notification that it receives from a consumer reporting agency under section 1681c-2 of this title relating to information resulting from identity theft, to prevent that person from refurnishing such blocked information.

The reference items are listed below please take this matter very serious JEFFERSON CAPITAL SYST XXXX I have report your company to consumerfinance.gov As a form of record and I am prepare to sue your company Example In re XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Telephone Consumer Protection Act Litigation, Case No. 11-MD-2295-JAH-BGS, in the U.S. District Court for the XXXX District of California Stop collection proceedings against me Signatures on applications and accounts Investigators report XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
States Recovery System continues to, despite my demand for them to cease, contacting my employer. 

State Recovery System was informed by telephone on XX/XX/XXXX, and again on XX/XX/XXXX, that my employer prohibits personal calls ( specifically relating to debt collection ). Specifically, on both of the above dates, State Recovery System 's representative XXXX XXXX was told this and also informed that calling my employer ( with knowledge ) of the prohibition is a violation of Section 805 ( a ) ( 3 ) of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. 

States Recovery System again, on XX/XX/XXXX, at approximately XXXX XXXX contacted my employer. 

States Recovery Systems violated FDCPA Section 804 ( 5 ), by informing my employer of their business name, i.e. " States Recovery Systems '' which connotes the call was related to the debt collection business, and the call relates to the collection of a debt. 

States Recovery Systems ' conduct is harassing and abusive. This is the exact conduct prohibited by the FDCPA, and because it has been repeated with directly knowledge of the violation, it is therefore reprehensible.

Consumer complaint narrative: A USPS certified receipt mail letter was sent to Experian and delivered on Monday, XX/XX/2019 requesting validation of debt from XXXX XXXX. In my request for validation, I reminded Experian that in accordance with their obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 U.S.C. 1681g the consumer is entitled to said records from said company or agency, the requested records which prove/show that the debt is indeed mine that were given to Experian to validate this debt. They must in accordance with their obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 U.S.C. 1681i delete this information from my credit report or send me copies of the  documents that they have in their files with verifiable proof. I also requested correspondence be in writing. As of today, XX/XX/2019, Experian has not provided me with verifiable proof or copies of the documents used to validate this debt. Instead, on XX/XX/2019, the company sent me a credit monitoring alert and email stating that the debt listed was not changed because the company " certified '' ( with no paperwork ) that the information reported was accurate. Experian is reporting incorrect information and refuses to produce record supporting documentation that any individual to whom gave the information or the documentation itself as requested. Consumer reporting agencies bear the responsibility to ensure the accuracy of the accounts they report and their responsibility must consist of more than merely parroting information received from other sources. An investigation that merely shifts the burden back to the credit grantor can not fulfill the obligations imposed by 1681 ( a ) ( 4 ).

Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
HSBC. 

I, XXXX XXXX, had lost my job in XXXX. Notified the mortgage lender, HSBC, of the matter. I didn't land a job until approximately 3 months later, informed HSBC that I will began making payments in doubles until I was caught up, however, they had told me that there was a new policy stating that the whole past due amount ( totaling appx. 5000.00 dollars ) would need to be paid. Furthermore, no payment smaller than the past due amount would be accepted. 

At that time, it was winter going into spring, in XXXX New York. Therefore, I was behind in the heat and electricity, the car loan, and owed back payments in child support. There was no way for me to be able to pay the amount that was requested by HSBC. Hence, the house ended up in foreclosure. I could not afford a lawyer, at that time and still can not. 

After many phone calls, and time passing, the loan that had plagued my life, had been closed. The house was sold in an auction in XX/XX/XXXX of XXXX, according to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( contact info : XXXX ). Although, on my credit report it shows that the account had been closed on XX/XX/XXXX. I do not understand how they had closed the account on this date when I was still making payments until I was unemployed. To make matters more confusing, this Monday, XX/XX/XXXX, I received a notice via XXXX XXXX stating that I owe HSBC a past balance of {$120000.00} dollars, yet the loan was for {$55000.00}. Even more confusing is that it states that I made a payment on XX/XX/XXXX. I WAS LIVING IN XXXX!!!!!!!! THE HOUSE WAS SOLD ALMOST A YEAR BEFORE THEN!!! WHICH, I HAD NO PRIOR INFORMATION ABOUT!!!!! 

I called HSBC ( contact info : HSBC BANK USA NA CREDIT INFORMATION DEPARTMENT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IL XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX ) looking for more info on the matter and they had directed me to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. No one had given me any information proving to me that I owe the amount, yet there is still another account on my credit report showing that I do not owe HSBC anything. I will print a copy of the report and send it to your mailing address along with a copy of this complaint.

He proceeded to state that my loan was not paid off and that I still owed {$450.00} since the first automatic draft did not complete. Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Originally, I sent a letter on XX/XX/2018 to XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) disputing a tradeline of my credit report from them. I requested validation, made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and the Fair Credit Reporting Act, along with the corresponding local state laws. I asked validation that was competent evidence bearing my signature, showing that I have ( or ever had ) some contractual obligation to pay them. On XX/XX/2018, I received a copy of Consumer Installment Loan Agreement and Federal Truth-in-Lending Disclosure from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX as their validation which wasn't validation competent evidence bearing my signature to XXXX. I received a credit bureau alert from XXXX ( betweenXX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX ) and TransUnion ( between XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX ) stating the collection item has been removed from my credit report. Then days later I received another credit bureau alert from XXXX  ( between XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX ) and TransUnion ( between XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX ) stating the collection item has been added back to my credit report. I sent a reinsertion letter to all three credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion ) stating I had not received the ( 5 ) day  notification which is required by law. All three bureaus stated they have validated this disputed item and refuse to remove and re-investigate in spite of all of the documentation I have provided to dispute the validity of this item. 

15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ( B ) Requirements relating to reinsertion of previously deleted material ( ii )  Notice to consumer If any information that has been deleted from a consumers file pursuant to subparagraph ( A ) is reinserted in the file, the consumer reporting agency shall notify the consumer of the reinsertion in writing not later than 5 business days after the reinsertion or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by any other means available to the agency. 
( iii ) Additional information As part of, or in addition to, the notice under clause ( ii ), a consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer in writing not later than 5 business days after the date of the reinsertion ( I ) a statement that the disputed information has been reinserted ; ( II ) the  business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available, or of any furnisher of information that contacted the consumer reporting agency, in connection with the reinsertion of such information ; and ( III ) a notice that  the consumer has the right to add a statement to the consumers file disputing the accuracy or completeness of the disputed information.

Product: Mortgage
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Senator XXXX, AGO XXXX and Consumer Protection Bureau via Complaint ID # XXXX As your offices are aware, we have experienced deplorable customer service from JPMorgan Chase on our home mortgage and line of credit since XX/XX/XXXX. 

We are seniors and XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX MA XXXX, has been our primary residence since XX/XX/XXXX. We purchased our home on no doc through Washington Mutual. Chase took over the loan in XX/XX/XXXX and we refinanced from a 30 year fixed to a 15 year fixed mortgage Chase in XX/XX/XXXX. At the closing, Chase asked if we wanted a $ XXXX line of credit. We elected to accept only $ XXXX at the time, which was not accessed until XX/XX/XXXX. In  late XX/XX/XXXX, Chase invited us to increase our HELOC line from the $ XXXX to $ XXXX, but at an increase of 2 % on the entire balance. Going through the financial crisis causing negative Government effect on my FCC Broadcast ownership, XXXX and XXXX children in college, we accepted going forward with the new terms. Chase then delayed for months stating our home value decreased and despite adequate funds in the bank and questioned amount of money I was taking from my owned radio station XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, MA. In XX/XX/XXXX, Chase finally dictated to us that our only option was modification but we had to skip two payments to be considered. 

Chase then reported us to the credit bureaus and the modification approval for the stated 60 months finally came in XX/XX/XXXX, but extended only 42 months with a balloon payment for the full mortgage due XX/XX/XXXX. In XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX, Chase miscoded a bank routing number on a payment and then took months to determine it was their error. Then, Chase interrupted our applications for new financing by starting foreclosure notices. Chase further delayed and hindered our efforts to change lenders. 

Finally, after finally being put in touch with the Chase Executive Office in XX/XX/XXXX,  Chase agreed, in XX/XX/XXXX to a second modification at our out of pocket cost of {$36000.00}. Chase refused to spread that amount over the ensuing 200 payments in the second modification. 

In both XX/XX/XXXX and upon our XX/XX/XXXX approval of the second modification, Chase promised to A ) adjust late fees, interest charges and legal fees, B ) make sure the credit bureaus knew we were up to date on the mortgage & HELOC, C ) correct Chases superficial appraisal of our home which is at least $ XXXX too low - $ XXXX compared to a complete modification performed by XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX at $ XXXX - and D ) make arrangements to finally add to our line of credit. E ) The rate of interest on the new modification is quite high, 4.87 %. 

We continue to get lip service, run around, rude correspondence and phone conversation from Chase. The letters they have sent to me and your offices have no credibility as they do not address Chase mistakes and the horrible, inappropriate manner of customer service from Chase. The Chase letters repeat their old decisions that were incorrect in the first place. 

We are seniors, never bankrupt, with a Chase debt of less than $ XXXX on our primary/only residence HUD and the CPB valued several months ago at over {$1.00} million. Chase is disregarding the importance of our Senior Financial Health and discriminating against seniors ability to have simple access to less than 49 % of their home equity for medical, improvement, college and living expenses. Further, Chase has been rude and tremendously challenged in delaying proceedings. Chase representatives stall, take months to say its not this department and have told us to find another lender, get a reverse mortgage or move! 

With a tremendous amount of phone, email, letter, fax correspondence shared with your offices and Chase, I must ask that you now step in and hold Chase accountable for this harmful, stressful, prolonged and costly behavior negatively affecting us, and other senior customers. We ask for all fee and interest adjustments and for a favorable arrangement to have access to up to 49 % of our home FMV, without further delay. 

Please respond and thank you for protecting senior citizens who need and deserve your intervention. 

With our sincere appreciation, XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, MA. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Mortgage # XXXX Line of Credit # XXXX

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
We entered into a loan modification application process with Wells Fargo on our FHA Rehab mortgage in XX/XX/XXXXXXXX. We provided all requested documentation and were approved, and given a lower monthly payment on a 90 day trial period. No information was given as to how they arrived at this payment, or what would happen for them to achieve this payment amount, until AFTER we paid 3 months of trial payments. 

We made the first two trial period payments and Wells Fargo sent us a letter that we'd been removed from the program. I called them and found out they had sent us a letter that we had to sign and send back agreeing to the trial period. They didn't tell us it would be coming or required and it was apparently sent via regular mail, not certified or overnighted, and we never received it. That's 2 payments made. 

So they started us over again, new trial period, and we made 3 payments in XXXX, XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. That's 5 trial period payments we made at that point. We received an email that we'd been approved for the HAMP modification and would be receiving paperwork that we would need to have notarized and sent back. No details as to what it was or any figures. Just an approval email. 

We received an overnight packet from XXXX  with the modification paperwork and figures. I called in to Wells Fargo after looking over the numbers, and I wanted a detailed itemization of the figures that they came up with to modify the loan. My foreclosure " specialist '' could not answer these simple questions - even though all the numbers are there in their computer system. She got belligerent with me on the phone about how I " better make the payment '', etc ... I sent several emails and left voicemails with ABSOLUTELY NO RESPONSE back. NO email responses from her, NO letters in the mail, NO return phone calls. 

I called and made another payment over the phone with someone else on XX/XX/XXXX ( after no explanations, no responses and no calls returned ), and then on XX/XX/XXXX, I receive a letter in the mail that they " are no longer moving forward with the HAMP program '' for our account. 

A few days later, I receive a letter from their foreclosure attorney, and last Thursday, the sheriff posted the court documents on my front door that state our foreclosure hearing is set with the county on  XX/XX/XXXX. 

We qualified for, and were approved for, a HAMP loan modification. We did not however, know what was involved prior to the trial period payments - only what the payment itself would be. 

I am not happy with the modification numbers and did not sign the documents that were sent to me, instead I wanted to work with my mortgage company to see if there was an alternative, but they REFUSE TO RESPOND and now have us set for foreclosure. I feel my rights as a consumer have been violated by the mortgage company refusing to answer questions or explain their figures, which I believe are double-dipping, and possibly fraudulent or illegal.

I have all emails I sent to the foreclosure " specialist '' and records of calls and voicemails left that were never returned. Every letter the specialist ever sent clearly stated " please call me if you have any questions ''. I had questions - she refused to answer them, and then refused to respond altogether. She removed us from the program instead. Even though we qualified for assistance. I just want to verify the numbers before signing - because they show that we will end up owing more than we started with after making three years ' worth of payments. And they were increasing our interest rate, not lowering it. They took a chunk of the principal balance and " amount in deliquency '' ( the number they refused to explain how they arrived at it ) and are setting it out as a perpetual silent second mortgage that will never be paid down or paid off until we sell or refinance the property. At which time, WF will receive all of that money - double dipping when they get it. We were not given any other option as far as lower interest rate, extended term of the mortgage, nothing.

And now, thanks to WF XXXX us around, we're even further behind in the payments. This should have been handled in a timely manner and it was NOT. It's been over 90 days since I made the 3rd payment of the trial period, and I made an additional payment last month in XXXX after not hearing anything from them. Now that they've set a court hearing, they won't accept another payment from me, and that will cause more months to go behind. 

On top of that, this company receives millions of dollars in HAMP funds each year to help people struggling with their payments - there is no evidence in these numbers that ANY HAMP funds were being used to help us. I'm not asking for free money, but if the government intends those funds to be used to help people, and WF isn't using them to do just that, then WHAT ARE THEY DOING WITH THOSE MILLIONS ( WILL BE BILLIONS BY XXXX WHEN IT ENDS ) OF DOLLARS IN HAMP FUNDS? Are they just eating that money? My trial payment letter clearly states we were in a HAMP loan modification. But every dollar is showing it's coming from us in the end, not HAMP funds at all. And now, the HAMP program is no longer accepting applications? 

I don't know where to turn at this point. But I believe this is an illegal foreclosure. We did everything they asked us to do, and we had every right to question the numbers.

Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: Bank of America is the current mortgage servicer of my second mortgage which was sold in a mortgage securities pool in XXXX. The mortgage was fraudulent upon issuing. Pursuant to 10 PA Code Section 48.3, the company issuing the mortgage used and provided fraudulent information contained in these sections of the PA code : ( 1 ) A dishonest practice or conduct is characterized by a lack of truth, honesty or trustworthiness, or is deceptive or implies a willful perversion of the truth to deceive, cheat, or defraud. ( 2 ) A fraudulent practice or conduct is characterized by deceit or trickery, an intentional perversion of the truth to induce another to part with something of value or to surrender a legal right, or an act of deceiving or misrepresenting. Fraud also includes any other  definition of fraud under applicable law. Example A : A mortgage originator employed by a mortgage broker has promised a certain low-rate mortgage loan to a consumer. However, the consumer does not have the minimum debt-to-income ratio set by the lender preferred by the mortgage originators employer to qualify for the lowest-rate mortgage loan offered. Therefore, the mortgage originator changes the XXXX statement of the consumer to reflect a higher income for the consumer without the consumers knowledge, and then submits the documentation to the lender. Example B : An employee of a mortgage lender contacts a real estate appraiser with a request to perform an appraisal and informs the appraiser that the sale price of the property is {$150000.00}. The employee knows that the property will not appraise for that amount, but promises the appraiser future business if the appraiser can make the deal work. The mortgage loan is closed by the mortgage lender based upon the appraisal report showing the value of the property as {$150000.00}. I was tricked into this mortgage during desperate times. The interest rate is 9.75 % fixed. I had been paying interest-only for 10 years, and in XXXX I was required to start paying principal and interest. I have been struggling with these payments and will not be able to hold on much longer. I love my house and want to spend the rest of my life here. Please help me.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To : XXXX XXXX XXXX Complaint Resolution Manager Re : {$350000.00} wire transfer to XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2018 Dear Mr. XXXX : My name is XXXX XXXX, and I am the sender of the above referenced wire transfer to BB & T Bank.
